name: MakeCert
description: Creates a private RSA key and a self signed certificate on a target machine
author: Seva Alekseyev

inputs.name: Server
inputs.label: Server:
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target machine name. DNS aliases are welcome. If blank, localhost is assumed.

inputs.name: DN
inputs.label: Distinguished name:
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The subject for the certificate, as an X500 distinguished name. Provide as a semicolon separated list of named values, read right to left.
For example: `CN=foo;OU=IT;O=ACME Software;L=Seattle;ST=Washington;C=US`

inputs.name: Lifetime
inputs.label: Lifetime (days):
inputs.helpMarkDown: The expiration date will be set to that many days from the creation time.

inputs.name: FriendlyName
inputs.label: Friendly name:
inputs.helpMarkDown: This line only displays in the certificate management UI of Windows. Leaving it blank is fine.

inputs.name: SAN
inputs.label: Subject alternative name:
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the values for the Subject Alternative Name extenion, one value per line, in the `type=value` format, where `type` can be:
 - DNS
 - Email
 - IP
 - URI
 - Name
For TLS server certificates, modern browsers require at least one `DNS=(hostname)` line here.

inputs.name: Length
inputs.label: Key length:
inputs.helpMarkDown: RSA key length, in bits. As of late 2021, 2048 is considered secure, 1024 is not.

inputs.name: Exportable
inputs.label: Mark as exportable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Leave unchecked if the private key is not expected to leave the target machine.

inputs.name: Permissions
inputs.label: Extra permissions:
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Users who should be granted access to the private key, in addition to the default SYSTEM and Administrators.
Each line should contain a username (presumed local on the target server), or a domain\username, or a [two letter code for a well known SID](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/secauthz/sid-strings). Prepend a line with a * for read-only access, otherwise full control will be granted.

inputs.name: KUCritical
inputs.label: Make Key Usage critical
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the key usage extension wlll be marked as critical. For a self signed certificate, it makes no difference.

inputs.name: EKUExtra
inputs.label: More:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide more OIDs for extended key usage, one OID per line. Lists of possible values are available online.

inputs.name: EKUCritical
inputs.label: Make Extended Key Usage critical
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the extended key usage extension wlll be marked as critical. For a self signed certificate, it makes no difference.

inputs.name: StoreName
inputs.label: Store name:
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This line determines which folder in the certificate store to store the certificate in. The line should correspond to the internal name. Valid store names are
 - My
 - AddressBook
 - AuthRoot
 - CertificationAuthority
 - Disallowed
 - Root
 - TrustedPeople
 - TrustedPublisher
[See the docs.](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/certificate-of-clientcertificate-element)
